title: Firefox in one user account won't open web pages even in Safe Mode
content:
I have two user accounts on my Mac which is running OS 10.13.6 High Sierra. I downloaded an update yesterday and now Firefox will not open any web page in one of the user accounts (1st account).

I tried clearing the cache and cookies, disabling extensions, disabling plug-ins, starting in Safe Mode and nothing worked. It doesn't open any web page in Safe Mode.

So I reinstalled Firefox, and the same exact thing; won't even open web pages in Safe Mode. The other use account (2nd account) works fine.

When I reinstalled Firefox I lost all the bookmarks and saved logins in the 1st user account. But the 2nd user account everything is fine. So I'm thinking I may have a corrupt plist file or something like that in the first user account.

I can restore from a backup, but I have no idea which files to restore.

Help?
creator: davec0864

title: Invisible Firefox Windows
content: Last night I shut down my Macbook and booted it up this morning. When Firefox started up I attempted to open my preexisting windows, of which I currently have 7. Strangely though, whenever I would try to open these windows, they would briefly display the animation of expanding onto my screen, but then would immediately disappear. This animation only happened the first time for each windows. I cannot interact with these invisible windows in any way. They still exist when I right-click Firefox to see my list of windows. So they aren't gone. Moreover, whenever I try to open one of these windows on top another program (i.e. Spotify) that program will go "dull" (literally darken its look) and my Macbook's top bar will switch to Firefox. It's the strangest thing. There was only 1 of the 7 windows that actually appeared when I clicked them all, and that window was one that I had adjusted to fill only half my screen. All the others were full-screen windows. Perhaps this is telling in some way? I have already attempted to restart my computer and I also quit Firefox and started it up anew. Neither approaches have worked.

title: Firefox will not open when clicked on
content: So up until very recently Firefox was working perfectly on my Windows 10 laptop. Now it will not open when I click on it. It has been my default browser and when I click on a link someone sends me, Firefox opens with no problem. It just will not open when I click on it in the task bar. I have uninstalled/reinstalled it, I have refreshed it as suggested, and I have deleted the processes within Task Management. None of the things suggested so far in the Community Support has worked. It is very frustrating so now I turn to those of you who might have encountered this problem and know a solution. It is also extremely frustrating and disappointing that the makers of this browser don't have a support number to help solve this kind of issue so I hope someone in this community can help! Thanks! I look forward to your response and solution!

I have tried the below to resolve on my end without success: 1. Upgrading to the latest release 84.0.1. Downgrading to 83.0 didn't help either 2. Tried checking safe mode and browser refresh and also with and without add-ons enabled 3. Tried tweaking the config gfx.webrender.enabled = true

I am using the x64 version on an updated Windows 10 system with Nvidia 940MX card.

Appreciate your help in resolving this.

creator: christian.a.herlein

title: Now have to mouse click the cursor in the search box before I can type
content:
Strange little problem has started recently and am thinking it might be related to the latest couple of FireFox updates. When I open FireFox and try to start typing in the search engine box, nothing happens...I have to click the mouse pointer on the cursor to seem to activate it for lack of a better term...and then I can start typing OK. [ No other typing / mouse click related problems with anything else what-so-ever ]

The cursor automatically goes right into the search box like it should, sitting there blinking for me to simply start typing from the keyboard. But typing is unresponsive, no typing occurs until I now take the extra step and mouse click on the cursor., then I can type OK.

Default browser is FireFox...the behavior is the same on multiple search engines of Google, DuckDuckGo, and Wikipedia. Since Firefox was a common denominator, I uninstalled FireFox, reinstalled it…but no help. Yet, if I try Internet Explorer from the ‘Windows Accessories’ section, it's search box typing works normally. Any experience / known issues would be appreciated.

title: Weird florescent lime green showing up over photos, behind streaming on hulu, and elsewhere
content:

Now, I'm noticing that the photos over article headlines on pocket and on facebook are sometimes partially or fully covered with the same florescent lime green. This color is brutal for a person who gets migraines. I'm attaching a print screen.

Thoughts? Thank you!

title: Drag and Drop gmail attachments from Firefox
content:
I am sorry to ask this question as I have been searching on and off for a long time on this.

I cannot seem to drag an attachment in my gmail (using firefox browser) to my desktop or folder wherever I need to save/download it to.

The icon options that show up when hovering over the attachment are download or add to drive. When you hit the download button a small window pops up with "What should Firefox do with this file?" I can open with Firefox, Open with...(dropdown list), or save file and it will automatically send it to my downloads folder.

Everything goes to my downloads folder. I do not have the option to "save as" in firefox.

It doesnt matter the attachment. If its a image file or pdf if I drag it to somewhere or my desktop I get the "preview attachement" clicking on it is a link to open the email in the browser it looks like.

I checked Firefox and it says it up to date 84.0 (64-bit) Ive checked all the other options I could find through different threads:

  • UAC
  • Disable all add ons
  • Start in Safe mode for firefox
  • Another two that I forgot

I dont remember having this problem as I was a firefox user for a long time. But over the past 2 years I switched to Chrome and now im trying to switch back to firefox. I have a lot of attachments in my emails that I need to go through on a constant basis.

The drag and drop function works in Chrome, IE, and Edge. Firefox is the only browser that it does not work in.

Windows 10

creator: phanhuutoan.dev

title: Why Firefox doesn't support Microsoft Teams meeting audio?
content:
When I try to join a Microsoft Teams meeting from the web (teams.microsoft.com -> calendar -> click on my meeting -> join), Microsoft shows me the following message:

Use the desktop app to join This meeting doesn't have a dial-in number, and your browser doesn't support Teams meeting audio. Learn more

Is it true that Firefox doesn't support "Teams meeting audio"? Which technology this audio is running through? Why does Firefox does not support it, if it doesn't?
creator: yuilytg7

title: Attempt to revert to earlier version won't install
content:
The new version of Firefox (84) is unusable on my Windows 10 (64-bit) computer. Attempts to navigate to to most sites cause the tab to disappear altogether, as do attempts to click on links to pages within sites such as Amazon. I had never seen any of these problems in my previous versions of Firefox extending back well over 15 years. Attempting to navigate to these same locations within Edge encounters no problems at all, leading me to infer that the problem is within this version of Firefox. Worse still, all my attempts to revert to an earlier version, using either the .msi or .exe file, fail to run. They begin execution and then just cease executing without a trace. I have tried version 79, 78, 77, and 76 with the same result. I have tried turning off my antivirus protection with no effect. I am about to become a disgusted former user of Firefox unless I can get some help here quickly.

Thanks for any help that might be offered here.
creator: jskprivate

title: GUI issue (Tabs on webpage gets mereged while using Big Screen Monitor)
content:
We are using Application installed within our environment. Tabs on webpage works perfectly fine using Laptop. But while using Big Screen Separate Monitor we face lots of GUI issue in Firefox.

Please help.
creator: apurv.tigdi

title: Audio not switching sources on firefox
content:
Hey everyone,

Tonight I've been experiencing this issue with specifically Firefox, where my audio outputs do not change sources. I use a program called Audioswitch to switch between speakers/headset at the touch of a keybind. I uninstalled and tried refreshing firefox but I still come across the issue where I switch from my headset to my speakers and the audio still only comes out of my headset. On other browsers, i can switch it manually from windows and they all work just fine.

So far I've uninstalled all extra apps such as audioswitch, voicemeeter banana (this issue did start within the same hour I installed and started messing around with this program, haha), and sounswitch (another program like audioswitch).
creator: riveroselliott

title: Flash Player ending on December 31st, 2020?
content: So, with official support for Adobe Flash Player finally ending on December 31st, 2020, is it safe to remove/uninstall its Plugin for Firefox browser, and how will it effect me using Firefox in the future?
creator: Teagan

title: How do I restore Logins and Passwords after clicking on reset to speed up Mozilla Firefox
content: Firefox was slowing down on my HP Laptop running Windows 10. Received a message at the bottom of Firefox screen asking if I wanted to speed-up Firefox press this button. Pressed button not realizing it would reset Firefox software losing all of my history, presets, etc. All of my passwords, including important banking,unemployment commission passwords and presets, education, everything all are missing. There was no warning or message stating that DATA MAY BE LOST or how to save information or locate previously saved presets or websites. In essence: I'm screwed. Spent hours going through everything I could think of on the Firefox website looking for ways to restore the data file so I could access/transfer passwords and bookmarks to current version of Firefox. Any suggestions and or help would be greatly appreciated.
creator: jaybwn

title: Youtube not signing in
content:
Hello, I am having a problem with YouTube not signing in correctly. I can sign in my Gmail account on google, but whenever I go you YouTube; it says that I'm not logged in. However, videos pop up that would normal be in my feed as well as my profile picture appearing in the top right corner. The picture that I attached should demonstrate what I am seeing.

So far, I have already cleared cookies as well as tried adding an exception for YouTube. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: andrew99tteson

title: Is there a way to get rid of the "Search the Web" bar in the middle of the screen on new tabs?
content: The image I attached is the bar I'm talking about. Is there anyway to remove this??

title: saving passwords
content: All I want to do is transfer save logins from a PC that crashed to a new laptop. I have the HDD and there is n .json file, or any way to merge it from what I can find. Any help here since Mozilla only pushes FAQ;s instead of help?
creator: zerosumgame0005

title: Hotmail and Firefox
content: Hotmail loads, but when I try to open/read an email, it gives me a screen that says to check my internet connection and/or try later. ALL other pages for other emails, web pages etc open just fine. There is NO issue with my internet connection. This device is connected via ethernet. Using the same modem, my android phone connects via wifi and hotmail works just fine. I have made NO changes to my browser (firefox), home network, modem etc. This is a FIREFOX issue, as I CAN open emails in Chrome and Edge on this device. ONLY Hotmail on Firefox is the issue.
creator: pennyking

title: Keep getting redirected to University of Michigan weblogin when I try to use Google services/sign-in
content:
When I try to sign in to Google services in Mozilla Firefox, I get redirected to University of Michigan's weblogin site/application. Even when I type gmail.com directly into the URL bar and press entire, I am redirected. The site I get redirected to is as follows, although I do not recommend following the link unless you know what you are doing:

https://weblogin.umich.edu/?cosign-shibboleth.umich.edu&https://shibboleth.umich.edu/idp/Authn/RemoteUser?conversation=e2s1

I have already tried going into Mozilla Firefox preferences and selecting Manage Data under the option to clear the cache and data. How do I remove the UMich's weblogin redirect?
creator: wvince77

title: When I switched from linux to windows, the firefox favorites were lost, and I logged in to the same account to sync, unresponsive
content: When I switched from linux to windows, the firefox favorites were lost, and I logged in to the same account to sync, unresponsive

title: Using software
content: I'm trying to use audials 2020 or audials 2021 to capture video streaming, but software doesn't detect any video after latest updates. It worked perfectly on firefox 75 64bit, but afterwards it doesn't. Checked with the manufacturer and they said it is a problem form firefox and their new configuration. Can you please help?
creator: srmandel

title: Media Source Extensions Error Message "Cannot play media. No decoders for requested formats"
content:
I've recently noticed that Firefox is sending the following error message to the web console for a web application that I'm developing :

Cannot play media. No decoders for requested formats: video/mp4; codecs="avc1.640032 mp4a.40.2", video/mp4; codecs="avc1.640032 mp4a.40.2", video/mp4; codecs="avc1.640032 mp4a.40.2", video/mp4; codecs="avc1.640032 mp4a.40.2"

This is happening in Firefox version 84.0 (64-bit) Windows 10. I restored a Windows system image made October 15th, that had Firefox version 81.0.2 (64-bit). The error message does not occur there using the same application software that does receive the error.

The error message doesn't seem to cause any issues. The 4 video streams still play normally. Does this error message indicate that there is a latent error in my application code that I need to resolve? Can you give an ideas what might be the cause of the issue? Thanks for any help in advance.
creator: mcwetzel158
